The CEO’s digital signature for a confidential message leaked—rumor says it’s breakable because of a small exponent. Can you recover the signed message from 0x21763e6b9e064358217c47383c518709a973a30b038eac6e333545d6dde1746269985e92c2427721fcc4f90141d9e152ff34c0c36d63441c1d7aa9e4583a14de?

Public Key (n, e): (4912909614263244534728214606802360549964450566637448160469861007044916648788508510415207554109520836416892439386978833667744886769206621680569602264307367, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{d3w8rwna}
ciphertext: 0x21763e6b9e064358217c47383c518709a973a30b038eac6e333545d6dde1746269985e92c2427721fcc4f90141d9e152ff34c0c36d63441c1d7aa9e4583a14de
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (4912909614263244534728214606802360549964450566637448160469861007044916648788508510415207554109520836416892439386978833667744886769206621680569602264307367, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
